page.title: 11Customs.Agricultural Show.
page.content: For well over sixty years, the local farming community have worked together to put on the Newport and District Agricultural Show.This event is held traditionally on the second Saturday in June.The actual locaton of the show field has changed over the years but the format of the show has altered little during the passage of sixty years.There are still classes for heavy horses,cattle and sheep.Classes for pigs have been stopped following the risk of disease. Classes for riding horses are still popular but by far the largest entry for the Show is in the Show Jumping Section.Last year the Secretary,Mr.S. Watt recieved entries from over 350 competitors. A further tradition attraction at the show is a travelling fair,adding noise and excitement to the occasion.
